intro: Canthium barbatum var. gambierense, commonly known as gambier, is a flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, round seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and swampy areas. Its leaves are palmately lobed and can be used in traditional medicine and as a source of fiber.
